snippet: Louis Segna, who was convicted in August of falsely reporting emergencies, like explosions and death threats, received six months in jail.
abstract: Louis Segna is sentenced to six months in jail for making 911 calls reporting fake emergencies in Williamsburg, Brooklyn; had been convicted in August on three counts of falsely reporting an incident.
lead_paragraph: Louis Segna, who was convicted in August of falsely reporting emergencies, like explosions and death threats, received six months in jail.

headline.main: Brooklyn Man Sentenced for Making False Reports to 911
headline.print_headline: Man Gets 6 Months for False 911 Reports
